etymology.description: Pictogram: a kind of axe; later phonetically borrowed for abstract meanings. The axe blade separated into 口; later misread as 戈 + 囗 + 一 (“territory”).
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted an axe, whose blade later detached visually as a 口 component. Abstract senses like “or/maybe” arose through phonetic borrowing rather than semantic components. The resemblance to 戈 with an enclosure led to historical misanalysis.

examples.chinese: 你现在或明天来都可以(你現在或明天來都可以)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xiànzài huò míngtiān lái dōu kěyǐ.
examples.english: You can come now or tomorrow.

examples.chinese: 我们或去北京，或去上海(我們或去北京，或去上海)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen huò qù Běijīng, huò qù Shànghǎi.
examples.english: We may go to Beijing or to Shanghai.

examples.chinese: 结果或好或坏都说不准(結果或好或壞都說不準)。
examples.pinyin: Jiéguǒ huò hǎo huò huài dōu shuō bù zhǔn.
examples.english: The result may be good or bad; it’s hard to say.
